page.title: 09LIFE STYLE 3
page.content: The{SHEPHERD}remembers : there were gates on the road at Marshside then,like a turnpike. We kids could get money opening them for rich visitors{.BARGES}used to come to Reculver with manure from London, they went back with hay. Sometimes there was trouble in the community {RICK BURNING.}About 1929 it was very bad, whole farms burnt up. All the marshes were grazing land and we kids could roam where we liked, everybody knew you by name out as far as Brooksend and Canterbury.In{WWII}the whole area was a training ground. you did not know what would happen next, with bullets flying around. My old horse would stand without looking while they fired a 2" mortar next to it all day. the Shepherd was in the L.D.V. attendence one night a week. some bombs fell in the area.
